meanings.definition: A device that automatically regulates temperature
meanings.sent1: The thermostat in our house keeps the temperature just right.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to set the thermostat to a comfortable level before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The thermostat decided it was too cold and turned up the heat all by itself!
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted like a thermostat, soothing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The thermostat clicked softly as it adjusted the room's temperature.

meanings.definition: A control that activates heating or cooling systems
meanings.sent1: Dad adjusted the thermostat to warm up the house on a chilly evening.
meanings.sent2: The thermostat can be set to cool the room during hot summer days.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the thermostat, causing the room to get too warm.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a thermostat, triggering a wave of emotions in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The thermostat hummed softly as it signaled the air conditioner to start.

meanings.definition: A mechanism that maintains a set temperature
meanings.sent1: The thermostat ensures the room stays at the desired warmth.
meanings.sent2: In the bakery, the thermostat keeps the ovens at the perfect baking temperature.
meanings.sent3: The curious toddler thought the thermostat was a magical button that controlled the weather.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted like a thermostat, brightening up the gloomy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The thermostat's display showed the current temperature and the set target clearly.
